H0.text: Salt and sand are added to hot water and stirred, making a mixture, is the correct procedure that describes materials combining.

H1.text: Oil and water are placed in a sealed bottle and shaken, making a compound.

H2.text: Sugar and water are added to flour and cooked in an oven making an element.

H3.text: Soil and water are shaken in a container and left to separate forming two elements correctly describes the procedure for materials combining.

A4.text: Mixtures are one product of mechanically blending or mixing chemical substances such as elements and compounds, without chemical bonding or other chemical change, so that each ingredient substance retains its own chemical properties and makeup.

A5.text: For an emulsion, these are immiscible fluids such as water and oil.
